Magic & Spellcasting

Complete system for casting and managing spells

Spell Levels

Every spell has a level from 0 to 9:

  • Cantrips (Level 0): Can be cast at will, no spell slot required
  • Levels 1-9: Require expending a spell slot of the spell's level or higher

Spell Schools

SchoolFocus
AbjurationProtective magic, wards, barriers
ConjurationSummoning creatures and objects
DivinationRevealing information, scrying
EnchantmentInfluencing minds and emotions
EvocationElemental energy, damage
IllusionDeception, false images
NecromancyLife, death, undead
TransmutationAltering physical properties

Spell Components

V (Verbal): Spoken incantation required

S (Somatic): Hand gestures required (need one free hand)

M (Material): Physical components required. Listed materials can be replaced by a spellcasting focus unless they have a cost or are consumed.

Casting a Spell

  1. Choose spell from your prepared/known spells
  2. Expend spell slot of appropriate level (or higher for upcasting)
  3. Declare target(s) within range
  4. Provide components (V, S, M as needed)
  5. Resolve effects (saving throws, attack rolls, damage)

Spell Slots

Spell slots represent your magical energy. Each slot has a level (1-9):

  • Casting a spell expends a slot of that spell's level or higher
  • Regain all expended slots on a Long Rest
  • Some classes regain slots on Short Rest

Upcasting

Casting a spell using a higher-level slot often increases its power (see spell's "Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot" section).

Spell Attack Rolls

Formula: 1d20 + spellcasting ability modifier + proficiency bonus

Compare to target's AC. Critical hits apply (natural 20).

Spell Save DC

Formula: 8 + spellcasting ability modifier + proficiency bonus

Targets make saving throws against this DC.

Spellcasting Ability

ClassAbility
Bard, Paladin, Sorcerer, WarlockCharisma
Cleric, Druid, RangerWisdom
WizardIntelligence

Concentration

Some spells require concentration (see Concentration system):

  • Can only concentrate on one spell at a time
  • Lasts up to spell's duration
  • Ends if you cast another concentration spell
  • Must make Constitution save if damaged (DC 10 or half damage)

Ritual Casting

Spells with the "ritual" tag can be cast as rituals:

  • Takes 10 minutes longer to cast
  • Doesn't expend a spell slot
  • Must be prepared/known (class-dependent)

Spell Preparation

Prepared Casters (Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Wizard):

  • After Long Rest, choose spells from class list
  • Number = spellcasting ability modifier + class level (minimum 1)
  • Can only cast prepared spells

Known Casters (Bard, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock):

  • Learn limited number of spells (see class table)
  • Can cast any known spell (no daily preparation)
  • Can swap one spell per level up

Cantrips

  • Level 0 spells
  • Can be cast at will, unlimited times
  • Don't require spell slots
  • Scale in power at character levels 5, 11, and 17
